snippet: Bo Xilai, the charismatic and controversial Communist Party chief from the megacity of Chongqing, has been removed from his post, the official Chinese news agency said Thursday. Undone by a recent scandal that rocked his city and riveted the nation,...
abstract: Bo Xilai, the charismatic and controversial Communist Party chief from the megacity of Chongqing, has been removed from his post, the official Chinese news agency said Thursday. Undone by a recent scandal that rocked his city and riveted the nation, Mr. Bo's career trajectory had seemed pointed toward an apogee in the autumn - election to the all-powerful Standing Committee of the Politburo, a nine-member body that effectively runs the country. Now, that's almost certainly out of the question.

headline.main: Upstart Leader in China Is Removed From Party Post
